title: Software Engineer
description:
We are seeking excellent and passionate engineers to work on projects across our business. Our main news website theguardian.com, which serves millions of readers each day, has traffic peaks of up to 1200 pages per second and close to 100% uptime. Our Open Platform makes our content available not just to our internal websites and mobile applications but also many other partners and developers.

We have many projects in progress simultaneously and our teams are given the autonomy to choose the right technologies to solve their problems. Our core platforms are Scala, JavaScript, Play and Amazon Web Services.

Our developers are continually developing their skills and are eager to learn new things, displaying the aptitude to change and respond to a changing news situation. They are at the forefront of our work to create a Guardian for the new century.

title: Senior software engineer
description:
Senior engineers are experienced developers with a variety of experience across domains and technologies. They have established their own areas of knowledge and expertise but are willing to share what they know and are always eager to learn new things.

They are humble and moderate in their views. Happy to mentor a junior developer, capable of leading a team or supporting one of their peers to deliver a shared technical vision. They see the world in terms of potential solutions, not problems. They support their opinions with data and metrics rather than rhetoric. They find out how to delight our journalists and readers and deliver the things that really matter to our organisation.

title: Client-side Developer
description: You’ll be an expert with CSS3 and modern JavaScript, comfortable writing OOCSS and using technologies such as AMD and CommonJS, and thinking and working in a responsive, progressively-enhanced manner. We’re looking for creative Client-side Developers with good knowledge of scalability and performance. Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3 is a must, and an eye for design and/or UX would be a bonus. Knowledge and experience of automated or multi-platform testing is desirable, too.

title: Interactive Developer
description:
The Guardian is seeking a talented Interactive Developer with a passion for interactive storytelling and data visualisation to join its award-winning newsroom interactive graphics team.

In this role, you will be expected to conceive of, design and develop ambitious pieces of visual journalism. You will work closely with reporters and editors on a range of editorial projects, from breaking news to investigations.

Your work will expand the reach and resonance of our reporting, helping readers better understand complex issues and furthering the Guardian's goal to be the world’s most trusted source for high-quality, independent journalism.

To succeed, you must have a track record of producing innovative pieces of interactive storytelling. You also must have expert-level front-end coding skills: HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Also critical is attention to detail, a pride in the quality of one's work and the ability to meet news deadlines. Experience with data-visualisation libraries like D3 or Raphaël is strongly preferred.

Although journalism experience is not a requirement, you must have a good understanding of the Guardian, an interest in current affairs and a strong desire to work in news.

title: SET (mobile)
description: We are seeking a technical, motivated and open minded colleague to join our highly respected, but relaxed Digital Development team as a Software Engineer in Test (SET) for our mobile team. As an experienced SET you’ll play a crucial role in making sure our millions of users get the service they expect. As well as leading the development of automation frameworks and creating tests, you’ll be finding and researching new techniques and tools and leading discussion with the team about how and where we can use them. You’ll be pivotal in helping shape the culture of the team, and embedding quality throughout the whole process of software development.

title: Quality Assurance analyst (mobile)
description: We are seeking a technical, motivated and open minded colleague to join as a QA analyst for our mobile team. As a QA you will be leading the functional, non-functional and regression test effort on our mobile products, either our Android or our iOS products. You’ll be concerned with the quality of our mobile products - right from the beginning of the product lifecycle through to when our apps are in users’ hands. And you’ll be pivotal in helping shape the culture of the team, and embedding quality throughout the whole process of software development.
